definition: finger/to point at or to/to indicate or refer to/to depend on/to count on/(of hair) to stand on end
4th note in pentatonic scale 五音[wu3 yin1], roughly sol/see also 徵|征[zheng1]
to invite/to recruit/to levy (taxes)/to draft (troops)/phenomenon/symptom/characteristic sign (used as proof)/evidence

sentences.english: Objective To analyze the etiological factors and antibiotics application in infantile diarrhea.
sentences.chinese: 目的分析嬰幼兒腹瀉的病因及抗生素的使用指徵。

sentences.english: Objective To describe the reasons for pregnant women choosing cesarean section without medical indication.
sentences.chinese: 目的深入探討無剖宮產指徵孕婦選擇剖宮產的原因。

sentences.english: Methods The indications of cesarean section that took place in hospitals both in city and in the country were analysed retrospectively.
sentences.chinese: 方法對城鄉兩所醫院剖宮產指徵進行了回顧性分析。

sentences.english: Pla cental disorder was the main indication of emergency hysterectomy.
sentences.chinese: 胎盤因素是產科急症子宮切除術的主要指徵。

sentences.english: Loss of dexterity is generally accepted as visible indicators of alcohol-induced intoxication.
sentences.chinese: 肢體靈活性的喪失通常被認爲是酒精影響的醉酒指徵。

sentences.english: Objective To study the advantage and indication of transventral approach in the treatment of cardiac cancer.
sentences.chinese: 目的研究經腹入路治療胃底賁門癌的獲益和指徵。

sentences.english: The effect of epidemic meningitis vaccine and the epidemic indication of epidemic cerebrospinal meningitis were analysed.
sentences.chinese: 並對流腦菌苗的效果和流腦流行指徵進行了分析。
